thread.title: Patriots QB Brady spikes Coke, frosted flakes
thread.title_full: Patriots QB Brady spikes Coke, frosted flakes

title: Patriots QB Brady spikes Coke, frosted flakes
text:
Patriots QB Brady spikes Coke, frosted flakes - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social Member Center: Patriots QB Brady spikes Coke, frosted flakes Posted: Updated: Patriots star signal caller Tom Brady questioned if frosted flakes was even food. (Source: WCVB/CNN) 
(CNN) - Coca-Cola and Kellogg's aren't happy with New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady. The football star criticized their products in a Boston sports radio interview on Monday. 
Brady called Coke "poison for kids," and questioned whether frosted flakes was actually food. 
He was responding to criticism of a friend and business partner, Alex Guerrero. A recent magazine profile claimed Guerrero lied about being a doctor, and falsely claimed his nutritional supplements cured cancer. 
Coca-Cola and Kellogg's hit back in statements released on Tuesday. Coca-Cola said its products are safe and could be part of a balanced lifestyle. 
Kellogg's pointed to multiple studies linking cereal with good health.
